actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Social Security.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to restore from age sixteen to age eighteen the age of a child at which certain benefits under such title are terminated.
short_title: Social Security Children's Benefits Act of 1987
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Social Security Children's Benefits Act of 1987 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to terminate a nondisabled child's entitlement to child's insurance benefits when such child reaches age 18. (Currently, such entitlement ceases when the child reaches age 16.)

titles.title: Social Security Children's Benefits Act of 1987
A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to restore from age sixteen to age eighteen the age of a child at which certain benefits under such title are terminated.
